The house was nice and comfortable. It was a very hot day and we were greeted by a cool air conditioned home. The house is located in a rural/suburban neighborhood between Green River and Rock Springs. The neighborhood is old with a mix of homes and mobile homes, but is quiet and we felt very safe.
Downstairs there is a very well appointed kitchen with modern appliances that are in good condition. The counter tops are old but while we were there a contractor stopped by to take measurements to replace them. The washer and dryer are very nice. The living room is large with a huge screen tv and several streaming services available. The furniture is newer and comfortable.
The living room is divided into two levels with 1 step between the levels. This turned out to be a problem for us. I accidently fell into the lower lever and hurt myself. This is a problem that should be addressed. A simple railing between the levels would make the rental much safer.
The upper level has 4 bedrooms, 2 of which are air conditioned. The bed in the master bedroom was very comfortable and connected to a full bath.
The back yard is lovely. Well landscaped, in good condition, and private. The hot tub is a great asset.
The owner was quite attentive and took care of the two minor issues we had very quickly. He appears to be committed to making this rental as pleasant and comfortable as he can.

The rooms upstairs do have a bit of a smell to them I’m guessing it’s the carpet, it’s tolerable but it’s there. & the lights above the hot tub are broken and hanging to low. The cottage is so cute and charming. Anna is obviously a super talented designer and she responded very quickly to us and even accommodated a date change. The beds are comfy and my kids loved the adorable purple bath tub. Great option for couples or singles or people with older kids.
We gave it 4 stars overall because ultimately it wasn't a great fit for our family. We have 2 small children and the overly restrictive rules made it very hard to relax. Yes, we read them when we booked (I get why they did it but I was not a fan of the semi-condescending "find the silly phrase" game to be able book) but they are slightly different in wording when you get there and maybe we are overthinking it but those difference were meaningful in practice. "The pillows and throws are not for personal use" is not the same thing as "you need to put them all in a closet away when you get there." This begs the question as to why they are out to begin with? You are not allowed to eat or drink anything anywhere except in the kitchen which is one of the most bizarre rules I have ever encountered in an AirBNB. Again the listing made it seem like a suggestion and that only the bedrooms are off limits (which is reasonable) but when you get there they are stated such that the kitchen is the only place you can eat or drink. I wanted to have a tea and watch TV in the living room but realized I couldn't. We also had a very weird exchange around COVID that rubbed me the wrong way but rest assured the home was very very clean and we didn't encounter any people during the stay. Overall not a fit for us and we will not stay here again but I think it will be great for most people.

review_text: This was arguably the best Airbnb I've ever stayed in. We were only here for one night, on our way home to Denver from a long road trip visiting family in Oregon. This felt like a high end boutique hotel in place like Portland, OR or somewhere. For one, it was the cleanest place I've ever been in, hands down. In the era of COVID-19, this was very reassuring. It felt like we were walking into someplace that had never been stayed in before. Even the toilet bowl felt brand new. For a one hundred year old cottage to feel this sparkling clean is truly a feat. I will also note how thoughtfully designed the whole place is. Every room, every corner has such a stylish and thoughtful touch to it. You could spend an hour or two just wandering through the home and admiring each unique aspect to Anna's decorating style. We loved the toys and books for the kids. The beds and bedding were extremely comfortable. The whole house was very easy to navigate thanks to all of Anna's notes. It's also just a great house and great space. I would've loved to live in this house in another life. While we didn't explore much of Rock Springs, this house is in a great spot to wander two blocks into the main downtown district. I wish we could've spent a longer time here and enjoyed a cup of wine on the front porch and watched the sun go down over the mountains. Not sure we'll ever make it back to Rock Springs, but if we do, we will definitely try to stay here.
